tit.cmt: ※「ナポリタン」には“Naporitan”と“Napolitan”の2つの表記がありますが、Wikipediaのメインエントリーが“Naporitan”であり、また日本ナポリタン学会でも“Naporitan”のスペルを採用していることから、以下の文章で日本の「ナポリタン」を指す場合は“Naporitan”とし、それ以外は“Napolitan”としています。
タイトルはこちらのnaporitan のみとしました。

sen.j: ナポリタンは日本のトマトケチャップ味スパゲティ料理。
sen.e: Naporitan is a Japanese spaghetti dish flavored with tomato ketchup.
Naporitan is a Japanese spaghetti dish flavored with tomato ketchup.
Naporitan (Napolitan) is a Japanese spaghetti dish flavored with tomato ketchup.
sen.cmt: 括弧の中にNapolitan を追加しました。

sen.j: 西洋料理のパスタを日本人の好みに合うように創作された洋食である。
sen.e: It is a yoshoku (Western-style Japanese cuisine) made by arranging pasta, a Western cuisine, to suit Japanese tastes.
It is a yoshoku (Western-style Japanese cuisine) made by arranging pasta, a Western cuisine, to suit Japanese tastes.
It is a yoshoku (Western-style Japanese cuisine) made by arranging pasta, a Western cuisine, to suit Japanese tastes.

sen.j: スパゲッティにトマトケチャップをからめ炒めて作る。
sen.e: To make Naporitan, one cooks spaghetti after dressing it with tomato ketchup.
To make Naporitan, one cooks spaghetti after adding tomato ketchup.
To make Naporitan, one cooks spaghetti after adding tomato ketchup.

sen.j: 代表的な具材はタマネギ、ピーマン、これにハム、ウインナーソーセージ、ベーコン等の加工肉。
sen.e: Typically, its ingredients include onion and green peppers, as well as processed meat like ham, sausage and bacon.
Typically, the ingredients include onion and green peppers, as well as processed meat like ham, sausage, and bacon.
Typically, the ingredients include onion and green peppers, as well as processed meat like ham, sausage, and bacon.

sen.j: タバスコとパルメザンチーズが共に給仕されることが多く、好みによってこれをかける食べ方が定着している。
sen.e: It is often served along with Tabasco sauce and Parmesan cheese, which are commonly sprinkled on it according to taste.
It is often served along with Tabasco sauce and Parmesan cheese, which are commonly sprinkled on it according to taste.
It is often served along with Tabasco sauce and Parmesan cheese, which are commonly sprinkled on it according to taste.

sen.j: 語源になったとされるNeapolitanは英語でナポリ風を意味する。
sen.e: The word Neapolitan, from which Naporitan took its name, means Napoli-style in English.
sen.cmt: ※このような場合、「Neapolitan」には“ ”を付けたほうがいいかと思います。
sen.e: The word Neapolitan, from which Naporitan took its name, means Napoli-style in English.
The word Neapolitan, from which Naporitan took its name, means Napoli-style in English.

sen.j: 『調理した具材を茹でたパスタと共にケチャップで和える』という日本の日常食生活でいうところのナポリタンは、太平洋戦争終結後、進駐してきたアメリカ軍によってもたらされたといわれている。
sen.e: Napolitan as eaten in Japanese daily life by "dressing cooked ingredients and boiled pasta with ketchup" is believed to have been brought by the American occupation forces after the end of the Pacific war.
sen.cmt: ※「～でいうところ」は英文として自然になるよう若干意訳しています。
sen.e: Napolitan as eaten in Japanese daily life by "dressing cooked ingredients and boiled pasta with ketchup" is believed to have been introduced by the American occupation forces after the end of the Pacific war.

Napolitan as eaten in Japanese daily life by "dressing cooked ingredients and boiled pasta with ketchup" is believed to have been introduced by the American occupation forces after the end of the Pacific war.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションマークを変更しました。

sen.j: 大量に作る兵食のため、軍隊ならではのポリシーのもと、味付けには簡便なトマトケチャップが用いられた。
sen.e: Made in large amounts for the troops to eat, it was flavored with easy-to-use tomato ketchup under policies typical to the Army.
Made in large amounts for the troops to eat, it was flavored with easy-to-use tomato ketchup under policies typical to the Army.
Made in large amounts for the troops to eat, it was flavored with easy-to-use tomato ketchup under policies typical to the Army.

sen.j: それはアメリカ軍における一般的な兵営食であり、大戦中はレーション(缶詰の戦闘食)としても汎用された。
sen.e: It was a regular food in the US Army barracks, and was widely used as a ration (canned food in battle) during the war.
It was a regular food in the US Army barracks, and was widely used as a ration (canned food in battle) during the war.
It was a regular food in the US Army barracks, and was widely used as a ration (canned food in battle) during the war.

sen.j: その調理法は、基地で働いた日本人コックなどにより巷にもたらされた。
sen.e: Its cooking method was introduced into the Japanese public by Japanese cooks who worked at US military bases.
Its cooking method was introduced into the Japanese market by Japanese cooks who worked at US military bases.
Its cooking method was introduced into the Japanese market by Japanese cooks who worked at US military bases.

sen.j: 戦後、横浜市山下町 (横浜市)にあるホテルニューグランドの総料理長であった入江茂忠が最初に日本におけるナポリタンを考え出した人物として記録が残っている。
sen.e: Existing records suggest that Shigetada IRIE, the executive chef of the Hotel New Grand located in Yamashita cho, Yokohama City, created Naporitan in Japan.
sen.cmt: ※「横浜市山下町」は用語集から採用しています。
sen.e: Existing records suggest that Shigetada IRIE, the executive chef of the Hotel New Grand located in Yamashita cho, Yokohama City, created Naporitan in Japan.
Existing records suggest that Shigetada IRIE, the executive chef of the Hotel New Grand located in Yamashita-cho, Yokohama City, created Naporitan in Japan.

sen.j: 同ホテルは戦後まもなく連合国軍最高司令官総司令部に接収され、ダグラス・マッカーサーが滞在していた部屋が現在でも残っている。
sen.e: The hotel was taken over by the General Headquarters of the Allied Powers (GHQ) soon after the war, and it still has a room in which General Douglas MacArthur stayed.
sen.cmt: ※マッカーサーを補足説明するため、「元帥」を追加しています。
sen.e: The hotel was taken over by the General Headquarters of the Allied Powers (GHQ) soon after the war, and it still has a room in which General Douglas MacArthur stayed.
The hotel was taken over by the General Headquarters of the Allied Powers (GHQ) soon after the war, and it still has a room in which General Douglas MacArthur stayed.

sen.j: このような当時の時代背景から、その頃まだ日本では一般人の食卓に上ることが珍しかったスパゲッティとケチャップを使った料理が進駐軍の好みに合わせて考え出されたと伝わっている。
sen.e: Based on these historical backgrounds, it is believed that spaghetti and ketchup, which were then not yet part of the Japanese diet at home, were used for cooking to suite the tastes of US troops.
Based on these historical backgrounds, it is believed that spaghetti and ketchup, which were then not yet part of the Japanese diet at home, were used for cooking to suite the tastes of US troops.
Based on these historical backgrounds, it is believed that spaghetti and ketchup, which were then not yet part of the Japanese diet at home, were used for cooking to suite the tastes of US troops.

sen.j: 進駐軍で食べていたスパゲッティにトマトケチャップを和えた軍用食からヒントを得て、ケチャップだけでなくトマトピューレ、調味料や具材を加え本格的な料理に仕上げた「スパゲッティナポリタン」としてホテルのメニューに載せた。
sen.e: Inspired by spaghetti mixed with tomato ketchup, one of the military rations of the occupation troops, IRIE added not only ketchup but tomato puree, seasoning and ingredients to make an authentic dish called 'Spaghetti Naporitan' and put it on the hotel's menu.
sen.cmt: ※原文には主語がありませんが、事実関係から入江総料理長と判断して訳出しています。
sen.e: Inspired by spaghetti mixed with tomato ketchup, one of the military rations of the occupation troops, IRIE added not only ketchup but tomato puree, seasoning and ingredients to make an authentic dish called 'Spaghetti Naporitan' and put it on the hotel menu.

Inspired by spaghetti mixed with tomato ketchup, one of the military rations of the occupation troops, IRIE added not only ketchup but tomato puree, seasoning and ingredients to make an authentic dish called 'Spaghetti Naporitan' and put it on the hotel menu.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションマークを変更しました。

sen.j: 当時のレシピを見ると、このホテルニューグランドのスパゲッティナポリタンはその後大衆化したナポリタンとは違い、後述のナポリ風ソースに近い料理であったようだ。
sen.e: According to the recipe from those days, this Spaghetti Naporitan in the Hotel New Grand was different from the Naporitan later popularized, but was apparently closer to the Napoli-style sauce described below.

According to the recipe from those days, Spaghetti Naporitan in the Hotel New Grand was different from the Naporitan later popularized, but was apparently closer to the Napoli-style sauce described below.

According to the recipe from those days, Spaghetti Naporitan in the Hotel New Grand was different from the Naporitan later popularized, but was apparently closer to the Napoli-style sauce described below.

sen.j: まだ日本人はアルデンテの食感に慣れていなかったために試食会では不評で、日本人の嗜好に合わせるために、7割方茹でたスパゲッティを冷蔵庫に一晩置いてうどんのような食感にした（未来創造堂より）。
sen.e: Since it was not well received at the hotel's tasting events by their Japanese customers, who were not yet familiar with the texture of al dente pasta, IRIE cooked spaghetti 70 percent through and let it stand overnight in fridge to get a texture like udon, to fit the tastes of Japanese (according to "Mirai Sozodo," a Japanese TV show).
sen.cmt: ※原文には主語がありませんが、事実関係から入江総料理長と判断して訳出しています。※「未来創造堂」の定訳は不明です。また、補足説明を加えています。
sen.e: Since it was not well received at the hotel's tasting events by their Japanese customers, who were not yet familiar with the texture of al dente pasta, IRIE cooked spaghetti 70 percent through and let it stand overnight in fridge to obtain a texture like udon, to fit the tastes of Japanese (according to "Mirai Sozodo," a Japanese TV show).

Since it was not well received at the hotel's tasting events by their Japanese customers, who were not yet familiar with the texture of al dente pasta, IRIE cooked spaghetti 70 percent through and let it stand overnight in fridge to obtain a texture like udon, to fit the tastes of Japanese (according to Mirai Sozodo, a Japanese TV show).
sen.cmt: アポストロフィーを変更しました。

sen.j: このナポリタンが一般的な食堂で提供されるようになると、まだ当時は庶民の手に入り難かったトマトピューレはケチャップで代用され、高価であった肉の代わりに、寄せ集め肉で作り皮を赤く着色したウインナーソーセージを入れた現在の料理へ変化していった。
sen.e: Once this Naporitan started to be served at average restaurants, ketchup replaced tomato puree, which was still not easily available to the public, and sausage made from mixed meat with red-colored casing replaced expensive meat, then becoming a dish as seen today.

Once this Naporitan started to be served at average restaurants, ketchup replaced tomato puree, which was still not easily available to the public, and sausage made from mixed meat with red-colored casing replaced expensive meat, then becoming the dish seen today.

Once this Naporitan started to be served at average restaurants, ketchup replaced tomato puree, which was still not easily available to the public, and sausage made from mixed meat with red-colored casing replaced expensive meat, then becoming the dish seen today.

sen.j: この庶民的なナポリタンは日本中の喫茶店や大衆食堂の定番メニューとして親しまれ、定着していった。
sen.e: This Naporitan with the common touch became popular as a staple dish at kissaten (Japanese-style coffee shop) and inexpensive eating places throughout Japan, and enjoyed continued popularity.
This Naporitan with the common touch became popular as a staple dish at kissaten (Japanese-style coffee shop) and inexpensive eating places throughout Japan, and enjoyed continued popularity.
This Naporitan with the common touch became popular as a staple dish at kissaten (Japanese-style coffee shop) and inexpensive eating places throughout Japan, and enjoyed continued popularity.

sen.j: 昭和期にはパスタの乾麺をアルデンテに茹でるという概念も一般的でなく、あらかじめ茹置きした麺をフライパンで味付けながら炒め直しする。
sen.e: During the Showa era when the idea of cooking rehydratable past noodles al dente was not common, people used noodles which were boiled and let to stand beforehand to reheat it in a frying pan while seasoning it.

During the Showa era when the idea of cooking rehydratable pasta noodles al dente was not common, people used noodles which were boiled and let them stand beforehand to reheat in a frying pan while seasoning it.

During the Showa period when the idea of cooking rehydratable pasta noodles al dente was not common, people used noodles which were boiled and let them stand beforehand to reheat in a frying pan while seasoning it.

sen.j: 調理感覚としてはソース焼きそばや焼うどんに近い。
sen.e: It was cooked in a way close to sauce yakisoba (fried soba seasoned with yakisoba sauce based on Worcester sauce) and yakiudon (fried udon).
sen.cmt: ※「ソース焼きそば」は用語集から採用しています。
sen.e: It was cooked in a way close to yakisoba (fried soba seasoned with yakisoba sauce based on Worcester sauce) and yakiudon (fried udon).
It was cooked in a way close to yakisoba (fried soba seasoned with yakisoba sauce based on Worcester sauce) and yakiudon (fried udon).

sen.j: ケチャップでの味付けが非常に簡便であることから、学校給食や家庭、喫茶店、軽食堂で供されることが多かった。
sen.e: Because Naporitan was very easy to flavor with ketchup, it was often served at school meals, home, kissaten, and lunchrooms.
Because Naporitan was very easy to flavor with ketchup, it was often served at school meals, home, kissaten, and lunchrooms.
Because Naporitan was very easy to flavor with ketchup, it was often served at school meals, home, kissaten, and lunchrooms.

sen.j: バブル景気の頃のイタリア料理ブームが起こる前、日本におけるスパゲッティ料理と言えばミートソースとナポリタンが双璧をなしていた。
sen.e: Before the Italian-cuisine boom during the economic bubble, meat sauce (Bolognese sauce) and Naporitan were two major spaghetti dishes in Japan.
sen.cmt: ※「ミートソース」は用語集から採用しています。
sen.e: Before the Italian-cuisine boom during the economic bubble, meat sauce (Bolognese sauce) and Naporitan were the two major spaghetti dishes in Japan.
Before the Italian-cuisine boom during the economic bubble, meat sauce (Bolognese sauce) and Naporitan were the two major spaghetti dishes in Japan.

sen.j: お子様ランチや洋食の付け合わせにもケチャップ味のスパゲッティは定番である。
sen.e: It was also a routine as a kiddies' lunch and a side dish to yoshoku.
It was also a routine as a kiddies' lunch and a side dish to yoshoku.
It was also a routine as a kids' lunch and a side dish to yoshoku.
sen.cmt: アポストロフィーを変更しました。

sen.j: 今でも根強い人気はあるが、様々な本格的パスタが食べられるようになった今日では、個人経営の喫茶店の減少とともに、ナポリタンを見かける機会はやや減りつつある。
sen.e: Although it still is a firm favorite, Naporitan has less frequently been seen with decrease in the number of privately managed kissaten now that a variety of authentic pasta is available.
Although it is still a firm favorite, Naporitan has less frequently been seen with the decrease in the number of privately managed kissaten now that varieties of authentic pasta is available.
Although it is still a firm favorite, Naporitan has less frequently been seen with the decrease in the number of privately managed kissaten now that varieties of authentic pasta is available.

sen.j: しかしながら近年の昭和時代の懐古ブーム（昭和レトロブーム）の影響で、ナポリタンが再評価されつつもある。
sen.e: Naporitan has been reassessed, however, as a result of the growing trend to look back on the Showa era in recent years.
sen.cmt: ※「懐古ブーム（昭和レトロブーム）」は定訳がなく、文字どおりに英訳すると不自然になるため、意訳しています。
sen.e: Naporitan has been reassessed, however, as a result of the growing trend to look back on the Showa era in recent years.
Naporitan has been reassessed, however, as a result of the growing trend to look back on the Showa period in recent years.

tit.e: Situations in Other Areas and Countries
Situations in Other Areas and Countries
Situations in other areas and countries
tit.cmt: 小タイトルのため、一部小文字に変更しました。

sen.j: 関西地方ではナポリタンをイタリアンと呼ぶこともあるが、具材を若干変えナポリタンとイタリアンの両方をメニューに載せている店もあり、何がナポリタンかの定義はレストランによりまちまちである。
sen.e: Although Naporitan is sometimes called Italian in the Kansai region, some restaurants have both Naporitan and Italian on the menu with slightly different ingredients, which leaves the definition of Naporitan up to restaurants.

Although Naporitan is sometimes called Italian in the Kansai region, some restaurants have both Naporitan and Italian on the menu with slightly different ingredients, which leaves the definition of Naporitan up to the restaurants.

Although Naporitan is sometimes called Italian in the Kansai region, some restaurants have both Naporitan and Italian on the menu with slightly different ingredients, which leaves the definition of Naporitan up to the restaurants.

sen.j: 名古屋にはイタリアンスパゲティと呼ばれる派生料理がある。
sen.e: There is a spin-off of Naporitan called Italian Spaghetti in Nagoya.
There is a spin-off of Naporitan called Italian Spaghetti in Nagoya.
There is a spin-off of Naporitan called Italian Spaghetti in Nagoya.

sen.j: また、東京等の関東圏では、具材はナポリタンとほぼ同じだが、ケチャップを使わず、ただ塩とコショウ（や醤油等）で味付けし、油炒めしたスパゲッティを「イタリアン」と呼ぶ事もある（こちらもパスタの本場、イタリアには存在しない、日本独自の料理である）。
sen.e: Additionally, in the Kanto region including Tokyo, deep-fried spaghetti flavored with salt and pepper (soy sauce) only and without ketchup is sometimes called 'Italian,' which is also a dish unique to Japan and not seen in Italy.

Additionally, in the Kanto region including Tokyo, deep-fried spaghetti flavored with salt and pepper (soy sauce) only and without ketchup is sometimes called 'Italian,' which is also a dish unique to Japan and not seen in Italy.

Additionally, in the Kanto region including Tokyo, deep-fried spaghetti flavored with salt and pepper (soy sauce) only and without ketchup is sometimes called 'Italian,' which is also a dish unique to Japan and not seen in Italy.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションマークを変更しました。

sen.j: 日本で最初にナポリタンを作ったと言われている横浜のホテルニューグランドのナポリタンのレシピは、現在日本でナポリタンとして知られるケチャップスパゲティよりも、フランスのスパゲッティ・アラ・ナポリターナに近い料理であった。
sen.e: According to the recipe of Naporitan in the Hotel New Grand in Yokohama, which is believed to have created the first Naporitan in Japan, its Naporitan was closer to Spaghetti a la Napolitana in France than the ketchup-tasting spaghetti known as Naporitan in Japan now.
sen.cmt: ※「スパゲティ・アラ・ナポリターナ」は、適切と思われる英訳を当てました。
sen.e: According to the recipe for Naporitan in the Hotel New Grand in Yokohama, which is believed to have created the first Naporitan in Japan, its Naporitan was closer to Spaghetti a la Napolitana in France than the ketchup-tasting spaghetti known as Naporitan in Japan now.

According to the recipe for Naporitan in the Hotel New Grand in Yokohama, which is believed to have created the first Naporitan in Japan, its Naporitan was closer to Spaghetti a la Napolitana in France than the ketchup-tasting spaghetti known as Naporitan in Japan now.

sen.j: イタリアにはナポリタン（イタリア語ではアッラ・ナポレターナとなる）と呼ばれるパスタ料理は存在しない。
sen.e: There is no such past dish as Napolitan (alla Napolitana in the Italian language) in Italy.
sen.cmt: ※「アッラ・ナポリターナ」は、適切と思われる英訳を当てました。
sen.e: There is no such pasta dish as Napolitan (alla Napolitana in the Italian language) in Italy.
There is no such pasta dish as Napolitan (alla Napolitana in the Italian language) in Italy.

sen.j: トマトケチャップはアメリカの調味料でイタリアでは一般には料理で使用されない。
sen.e: Tomato ketchup is an American seasoning and is not commonly used in cooking in Italy.
Tomato ketchup is an American seasoning and is not commonly used in cooking in Italy.
Tomato ketchup is an American seasoning and is not commonly used in cooking in Italy.

sen.j: アメリカでもトマトケチャップを加熱調理する味付けはまれである。
sen.e: Even in the US, tomato ketchup is rarely heated to season food.
Even in the US, tomato ketchup is rarely heated to season food.
Even in the US, tomato ketchup is rarely heated to season food.

sen.j: ナポリタンの名が付いたソースがある（wNeapolitan sauce）。
sen.e: There is a sauce named Napolitan in Italy: Neapolitan sauce.
sen.cmt: ※「イタリアには」と場所を指定しないと意味が成立しないので、追加しています。
sen.e: There is a sauce named Napolitan in Italy: Neapolitan sauce.
There is a sauce named Napolitan in Italy: Neapolitan sauce.

sen.j: これはトマト、玉ねぎ、にんにく、香辛料、パルメザンチーズなどから作られたソースで主にパスタに使用される。
sen.e: This is a sauce made from onion, garlic, spices and Parmesan cheese, used mainly for pasta.
This is a sauce made from onion, garlic, spices, and Parmesan cheese, used mainly for pasta.
This is a sauce made from onion, garlic, spices, and Parmesan cheese, used mainly for pasta.

sen.j: ナポリタンの起源はフランスで一般的に食べられているイタリア風のトマトソースパスタ「スパゲッティ・アラ・ナポリターナ」であるとの説がある。
sen.e: There is a theory that Napolitan originates from the Italian-style pasta flavored with tomato sauce spaghetti called 'spaghetti a la Napolitana,' commonly eaten in France.
sen.cmt: ※「スパゲティ・アラ・ナポリターナ」は、適切と思われる英訳を当てました。
sen.e: There is a theory that Napolitan originates from the Italian-style pasta flavored with tomato sauce spaghetti called 'spaghetti a la Napolitana,' commonly eaten in France.
There is a theory that Napolitan originates from the Italian-style pasta flavored with tomato sauce called 'spaghetti a la Napolitana,' commonly eaten in France.
sen.cmt: spaghetti を一箇所削除しました。クォーテーションマークを変更しました。

sen.j: イタリア料理でスパゲッティ・ナポリタンに比較的近い味のものに、アマトリチャーナ（Spaghetti alla amatriciana）がある。
sen.e: Spaghetti alla Amatriciana in Italian cuisine is relatively closer in taste to Japanese Spaghetti Naporitan.
sen.cmt: ※ここでの「ナポリタン」は日本のものを指していると解釈し、“Naporitan”とした上で“ Japanese”を追加しました。
sen.e: Spaghetti alla Amatriciana in Italian cuisine is relatively closer in taste to Japanese Spaghetti Naporitan.
Spaghetti alla Amatriciana in Italian cuisine is relatively closer in taste to Japanese Spaghetti Naporitan.

sen.j: パンチェッタ、タマネギのトマトソースにペコリーノ・ロマーノを好みでいれる、ラツィオ州（ナポリのあるカンパニア州ではなくローマ近郊）の料理となる。
sen.e: This is a dish in the region of Lazio, not Campania where Naples is located, eaten in tomato sauce made from pancetta and onion with Pecorino Romano if desired.
sen.cmt: ラツィオ州の中にローマ県があるという地理的な関係上、「ローマ近郊」という表現は不適切と判断し、省略しています。
sen.e: This is a dish in the region of Lazio, not Campania where Naples is located, eaten in tomato sauce made from pancetta and onion with Pecorino Romano if desired.
This is a dish in the region of Lazio, not Campania where Naples is located, eaten in tomato sauce made from pancetta and onion with Pecorino Romano if desired.

sen.j: アメリカで一般的に食べ物でナポリタンというとアイスクリームの一種を指す（wNeapolitan ice cream）。
sen.e: In American food, Napolitan suggests a type of ice cream called Neapolitan ice cream.
In American food, Napolitan suggests a type of ice cream called Neapolitan ice cream.
In American food, Napolitan suggests a type of ice cream called Neapolitan ice cream.

sen.j: 中国ではナポリタンというとミートソースが出ることがある。
sen.e: In China, Napolitan means meat sauce at some restaurants.
In China, Napolitan means meat sauce at some restaurants.
